sections.TOP:
Redwyne Straits07090acyaglrr9fnoe7gvomhv8co9bjjk9jd1203722014-03-28T18:43:51ZThe Dragon Demands5014364[[Image:Redwyne Straits.png|thumb|right|200px|A map showing the location of the Redwyne Straits off the coast of Westeros.]]
The '''Redwyne Straits''' separate the [[Arbor]] from the mainland of [[Westeros]]. They are controlled by [[House Redwyne]] of the Arbor and [[House Hightower]] of [[Oldtown]], who both have ships patrolling the waters. The area overall is under the authority of [[House Tyrell]] of [[Highgarden]].<ref>[http://viewers-guide.hbo.com/game-of-thrones/season1/#!/locations/highgarden/ HBO viewers guide, season 1 map, Highgarden entry]</ref>
sections.In the books:
In the ''[[A Song of Ice and Fire]]'' novels, the Redwyne Straits are usually peaceful. They are a center of trade, with ships passing through the straits from the city of Oldtown and ports on the Arbor to all parts of Westeros and [[Essos]], as well as the [[Summer Islands]] and [[Stepstones]]. In ancient times the straits were less safe, with the [[ironborn]] sometimes raiding as far south as their waters.

Towns such as Vinetown, Starfish Harbor and Ryamsport sit alongside it.
